reviews.review: Beautiful character arcs, brings back fan favorites.

hyped events fell flat.  events and connections appeared out of nowhere. terrible story (this movie and entire trilogy) that was basically rehashed from OT. no excitement was built, nor were any events ever explained throughout trilogy.

the scenes where oddly shot, the dialogue was clunky as hell and the story line was so diluted with fanservice. they tried to reach every type of fan to make them happy with out focusing on what would make a actually good story.
Trash that tries its best to undo the abomination that was the last Jedi but fails it fails hard.

Rise of Skywalker has helped me realise something about Disney's Star Wars films that I hadn't quite grasped or been able to put into words until now. I don't think Disney understands what Star Wars really is. What I have come to realise is that Disney believes that Star Wars is just a Sci-Fi adventure series based around these iconic characters... but it is not. Star Wars, from the Original Trilogy through the Prequel Trilogy, was a Space Opera Fantasy. Space Fantasy means that the story is based around the fantastical and unexplainable elements of Space, Sci-Fi means that the story is based a fictional science. Like the difference between Dark Fantasy and Supernatural, these are two separate genres with two separate emotional reactions. There's also the musical element that separates operatic media from all other theatrical media... opera incorporates the music into the actual story telling, where for most other media music is an accompaniment. In a normal film, the music is an extension that enhances the story. In an operatic film, the music is part of the story... and that's what the Disney Star Wars movies lost right after George Lucas lost control. The originals excelled in dialogue where the prequels did not. The prequels excelled in character arcs and storytelling better than the originals. The sequels are a shadow of both, a holo shell - not in quality... but in soul. I was wondering why the Disney films didn't feel the same as the George Lucas films, and now I know.
Must see if your a Star Wars fan

I LOVED this movie!!  All the "wtf" issues with the previous two are explained and tied up or built upon very nicely, resulting in a fantastic trilogy arc.  The cast itself seems to finally get to that chemistry spot enjoyed by the original cast in the premier trilogy.  Rey herself becomes a more likable character, in that they portray her as a vulnerable character who makes horrible mistakes and is truly in danger of being defeated.  I can't say enough about how I loved the reveal of the main antagonist.  No spoilers, but the Sith playing the ultimate baddie in the Star Wars Universe is one of the things that make Star Wars so good- whether it be the movies, the books, or the video games.  I highly recommend this movie, especially if you had misgivings in the Force Awakens and/or The Last Jedi.
Loved it, wish this vision was clear for the whole trilogy.
I have always loved Star Wars. I enjoyed the movie very much. I hope this will not be the last of the series.
